comment: I took him for a summer 4 week class and it was great! Only graded on 4 exams that are once a week. You can use notes and the textbook so everything was straightforward and easy. He sends reminder emails to keep you on track and is easy to get in contact with. Take him in the summer if you can for a quick credit but he is amazing regardless!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Definitely one of if not the best professor I have had. He loves to get the students involved in everything, whether it be the beginning of class discussion or the lecture itself. Open note exams are in D2L and done at home, and he encourages you to use notes and lectures on exam. Down to earth and just overall a caring professor.

TAKE HIM! He is the best professor I have had, he is so down to Earth and loves what he does, everything is no lockdown, open note, and he encourages you to use notes and resources. He is extremely caring for his students and there is no one else I would have rather had for this class. Attendance isn't mandatory but he gives extra credit for it.

Take him! He is an amazing professor, and loves what he teaches. I love going to his classes, because I leave knowing so much more. He cares about his students so much and makes sure you have every resource available. Attendance isn't mandatory, but it is noted if you do go to class. It's very worth it. If you can take him you won't regret it!

comment: take this professor u won't regret! the only assignment are test no lockdown. he says it mandatory for the textbook but in my opinion it is not. honestly you can use google and ai for help with the test.  attendance is not require but he does keep track who comes to class.

comment: I loved Professor Davis! His lectures were super interesting and engaging, and he cares a lot about maintaining a safe and relaxed class environment. It's best that you take notes and keep up with the readings since your only grades are tests, but they're open note and he's willing to work with you if you're struggling. Just a super cool guy!

I took him in person and it was mostly discussion based lectures. We had four exams based on the materials in class but they were straight forward and open note. Attendance is mandatory but it doesn't count against you if you skip too many classes.

he was such a chill professor. i took his online course and had todo these readings and quizzes at the end of the week. Towards the end he switches the quiz for mini essays which don't take too long. he's also very understanding and will let you make up things you missed. 10/10

Dr. Davis was very lenient and very helpful when I had surgery this semester. He allowed me to catch up on my work without penalizing me for it. His stories are very interesting. Weekly quizzes and exams had no trick questions. He really focuses on his students' learning rather than administering hard exams.

This is for the ANTH 3300 Anthropological Theory class, not ANTH 1102. This class was mind numbing and time consuming, but I would like to think that Professor Davis did the best he could to make it as bearable as possible.

comment: ok so what I have to say is that the class is easy because we do nothing. I failed the midterm and still got an A somehow. He tells you to read these weekly readings to be prepared for discussion, but then he just literally reads the articles to us, so you don't actually need to read them. Theres a researhc paper, but he just gave out 100s.
Professor Davis is pretty hands off. There was not any lectures or discussions, just weekly readings and weekly reading summaries, Two exams, a midterm and final. Very clear, nothing crazy.

comment: Professor Davis is very cooperative and loves talking with students no matter what the questions you have may be.

Two readings and one quiz per week. One major essay that is due at the end, but he gives you plenty of time and many deadlines over the course. If you don't do well on the essay, you won't pass. Lectures are more fun if you read before and participate. Chill professor
he's cool just isn't compatible with my learning style

comment: Took anth 3307. Prof Davis is very laid back & funny. He cares a lot about anth & makes it relatable to current issues. Bit disorganized, but it was his first time teaching this class. Prepare to read chapters from the textbook & do reading discussions every week. Attendance/participation is a grade but he's lax. Read lecture notes for exams.

Posts awesome slides and class notes. Everything you need for a quiz or test is on there. There was a big paper, but there were tons of different points for submission so he could give feedback, and he gave full credit for each of those, so it was free points for just working on the paper. Personally didn't need the book at all!

Prof Davis is a passionate teacher about his class. He reads off a slideshow everyday, but he makes the class interesting and engaging. His quizzes and tests are not difficult as he provides the slides and lecture notes before hand. Overall I would 100% take his class again.

comment: Professor Davis made our class interesting and relevant. I enjoyed listening to his lectures and listening to the previous work he did in the anthropology field.
